intro: Hieracium cottetii subsp. plankenhornii, commonly known as the Plankenhorn hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy habitats at high altitudes, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are generally basal, with a rough, hairy texture, and its flowers are yellow, often appearing in clusters. This subspecies is noted for its limited distribution and is considered a rare and specialized plant within its native range.
